medical_history.chief_complaint: The patient presented with core phenotypes of Auriculocondylar syndrome (ARCND) including decreased mouth opening, micrognathia, microstomia, prominent cheeks, glossoptosis, and postauricular tags.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Respiratory distress occurred within 4 days after birth, requiring hospital referral. The patient had poor feeding. At 17 days after birth, the patient underwent bilateral mandibular osteotomy and distraction osteogenesis. A second procedure was performed at 16 months old to improve mandibular growth. Primary teeth erupted at 10 months but were crowded with fragile enamel. By 2 years, the patient met normal developmental milestones, though speech articulation difficulties persisted.
medical_history.family_history: The patient has an unremarkable family history.
